definitions.definition: ( Abrahamism ) The first five books of the Hebrew Scriptures , traditionally attributed to Moses and therefore also known as the Five Books of Moses. [1570s ]
examples: Tradition holds that the Torah was handed down to Moses on Mount Sinai.

definitions.definition: ( Judaism ) The full body of written Jewish law , including the Tanakh , the Talmud , the Mishnah and the midrashic texts.
examples: It says in the Torah that both gossip and murder cause irreparable damage.

definitions.definition: ( Judaism ) The whole of Jewish law , both written and unwritten.
( Judaism ) The encompassing philosophy of Judaism .

main_definition: ( Abrahamism ) The first five books of the Hebrew Scriptures , traditionally attributed to Moses and therefore also known as the Five Books of Moses. [1570s ]
secondary_definitions: ( Judaism ) The full body of written Jewish law , including the Tanakh , the Talmud , the Mishnah and the midrashic texts.
( Judaism ) The whole of Jewish law , both written and unwritten.
( Judaism ) The encompassing philosophy of Judaism .

definitions.definition: A specially written scroll containing the five books of Moses, such as those used in religious services.
examples: An anonymous donor has provided us with a lovely new Torah .

definitions.definition: A book containing the five books of Moses.
examples: There was a lovely leather-bound Torah on the bookshelf.

main_definition: ( Abrahamism ) A specially written scroll containing the five books of Moses, such as those used in religious services.
secondary_definitions: ( Abrahamism ) A book containing the five books of Moses.
